means: （轮船、班机等）事务长，（尤指客轮上的）乘务长
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 珀泽职业名称，制作或销售钱袋者，或负责支出的官员，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“钱袋”(purse)
[人名] [苏格兰人姓氏] 珀泽盖尔语姓氏的英译，含义是“钱袋”(purse)

sentence.Network_en: The purser is always ready to help passengers during a flight.
sentence.Network_cn: 飞行时事务长通常随时准备帮助旅客.

sentence.Network_en: Just a minute. Yes, the camera was handed in to the purser.
sentence.Network_cn: 等一等. 是的, 照相机已上交到事务长那里了.

sentence.Network_en: I'll arrange the ship chandler to see your purser.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会安排船舶供应商见你们的管事.

entry.def: On a ship, the purser is an officer who deals with the accounts and official papers. On a passenger ship, the purser is also responsible for the welfare of the passengers.

means.word_mean: 1. an officer aboard a ship who keeps accounts and attends to the passengers' welfare

auth_sentence.content: The purser took the last landing-card.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The purser took the last landing-card.

auth_sentence.content: The purser mimicked the action of a man drinking and pointed towards me.
